text:
Floyd Douglas Little (July 4, 1942 – January 1, 2021) was an American professional football player. He was a halfback for the Denver Broncos from 1967 to 1975. He was born in New Haven, Connecticut.
Little was elected to the College Football Hall of Fame in 1983 and the Pro Football Hall of Fame in 2010.
Little died on January 1, 2021 from cancer in Las Vegas, Nevada at the age of 78.
